result.execSummary:
The defendant Gordon W. Fitzpatrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gordon W. Fitzpatrick

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gordon W. Fitzpatrick in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Withdraw repeater.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:
12 months Probation
DNA surcharge/sample
Undergo any counseling/evaluation per agent
$443.00 Costs fees (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) CASH BOND APPLY
Paperwork handed in court.

Pre-trial conference at 02-19-2016 09:30 am.
Return date at 03-03-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant Gordon W. Fitzpatrick appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney.  DE qualifies for PD representation.  State requests $500.00 cash bond.  Atty. ORourke makes argument for PA bond.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $150.00 Cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute Sobriety  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
